metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1329 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in oxide::qt::URLRequestDelegatedJob inoxide-qt in Ubuntu 15.04 and 14.04 LTS might allow remote attackers toexecute arbitrary code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1329` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.8.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.8.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.8.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
